definitions: To gradually grow faint and disappear.
To lose brightness or vividness of color.
To lose freshness, vigor, or strength.
To cause to lose brightness or vividness.
To cause to grow faint and disappear.
examples: The colors in the old photograph began to fade.
The sound of the music faded into the distance.
Her hopes started to fade after the news.
The sun will fade the curtains over time.
He tried to fade the memory from his mind.
